review: I was very disappointed with the Fire TV stick. Even after talking to support at Amazon, they told me themselves that the "mirror" function, even with an Amazon tablet, is flakey at best. The solution is a hard-reset of both units! Apparently there is some memory corruption that occurs. I have 30+ years of computer and networking experience, and after futzing with this thing for 2 hours I have up. Also, it frequently "freezes" during playback, and I'm guessing it is due to the fact that 1) Hardwired networking isn't an option and 2) the built-in antennas don't work well. The unit is only about 20 feet from a router on a 100mbps internet connection. I never had a playback problem before with my WD TV player even though it is also wireless in the same spot. It was a big mother's day gift FLOP! I want my 2 hours of life back!

review: Overall, I am glad that I purchased the Fire TV Stick. It is very easy to use, doesn't take up any space (as opposed to a wifi enabled DVD player), is fast, and I can take advantage of my Prime subscription on my TV. The remote buttons, on the other hand, started to squeak and stick the same day I opened the box and set up the system. Also, unbeknownst to me prior to ordering the Fire TV Stick, COMCAST does not support HBO Go or Showtime Anytime on this device. Bummer.

review: I previously used the Wii gaming system to connect to Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, and YouTube. It was my gateway into cable-free living. I went cold turkey and at the time, it was just the system I needed to get me through my cable withdrawls. But, over time it became less and less reliable, it just wasn't connecting. Freedom was being replaced with frustration. I even considered cable again. (GASP!) Then I heard there were other fish in the sea, ones that would connect, be consistent, more reliable. That's when I found fire. I asked around for some opinions because sometimes when you're looking for something new, you overlook some drawbacks. The feedback was positive! I am happy to report that fire and I have been strongly connected since Mother's Day and it has successfully kept me away from ever considering cable.
